title: Quake Champions

title: Quake Champions

title: Quake Champions
notes: Overally runs pretty smooth, but only on low settings. I had to set everything to low to avoid crashes and extreme freezes. When I start a match, there are still some short freezes for a few seconds, but then everything gets smooth after I traversed the whole map (shader caching).

title: Quake Champions
notes: Performance takes a good hit, and there's significant mouse lag. Game also freezes when any textures need to load.

title: Quake Champions
notes: Like Doom, use winetricks to install vcrun2015. Some stutter at the beginning of matches and when navigating menus. Set to Low, ~80 FPS on my system.

title: Quake Champions
notes: Roughly 10-20 FPS Lower than on Windows, so adjust your Graphics settings accordingly (Got ~70 FPS on 4K High, but Ultra dropped below 50).

title: Quake Champions
notes: FPS not consistent but not enough to be unplayable, but this may just be down to the test system not being capable (spec-wise) of running the game smoothly.

title: Quake Champions
notes: Can't connect to the server (Error 104)

title: Quake Champions
notes: Severe stuttering present possibly due to shaders compiling. Crashed on high settings after loading a tutorial match and firing a few rounds from machine-gun. Game actually starts and gets through splash-screens and intro movie compared to 3.7-4 Proton however. Main Menu works fine.

title: Quake Champions
notes: as of 9/03/2018 it is working. Prior to this date it would crash consistently, some times in the menu but mostly shortly after joining into a match or training. it might crash if you alt-tab out (at least for me) but so long as I dont do that I can successfully play, so far have played a few bot matches with out issue. few visual glitches in the store (textures not loading on faces). Had to run the game at lowest settings to get frame rates I could reliably play at but that might also be a symptom of my older hardware + compatibility, other wise runs very smooth in menus and does not take too long to load. will occasionally get stuck in load screens and lock up the whole pc.

title: Quake Champions
notes: as of today 9/6/2018 (after the latest 3.xGB patch), I started getting crashes at the intro, or getting error 104 on start

title: Quake Champions
notes: Error 103 in-game, D3D11 unsupported query type 6; "jack" backend initialization failure, D3D11_BIND_STREAM_OUTPUT failure, 314.885:0008:0056:fixme:winhttp:set_option unimplemented option 84
Unplayable; network problem report. Maybe some kind of anti-cheat is blocking Proton.

notes: Network problems when running Quake Champions with Proton. Probably some kind of anti-cheat.

title: Quake Champions

notes: Create a symbolic link to older version of gnutls as described in https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/225 to workaround connection issue.
title: Quake Champions

notes: Error 103
title: Quake Champions

notes: Using the libgnutls workaround. Runs fantastically overall, but eventually crashes at some point during an actual match. None of the suggested tweaks improve the situation.
title: Quake Champions

notes: Followed this guide: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/225#issuecomment-426213350 except using libgnutls.so.30.14.11 (check which is the highest one on your system by using the command "cd /usr/lib/ && ls | grep libgnutls.so" in terminal). Even with fix you need to turn details down to low or you'll crash when firing a beam weapon and even with that you might still crash in MP. Also very stuttery until the shaders are loaded.
title: Quake Champions

notes:
as mentioned needs https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/225 needs to be done

Set graphics to lowest, was crashing when loading in with graphics higher than low, drops frames
title: Quake Champions

notes: Need libgnutls worked around, then runs flawlessly.
title: Quake Champions

notes: copied libgnutls.so.30.14.11 from /usr/lib to /.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/pinned_libs_64/ and ran ln -s libgnutls.so.30.14.11 libgnutls.so.26 to make the network connection work with this game. Works without issues. 2560x1440 all high, resolution scale 100%, FPS 60-120, mostly around 85
title: Quake Champions

notes: Error 103 can be fixed with the gnutls workaround. Since Stream Output is enabled in Proton 3.16 the game does not crash anymore and is playable.
title: Quake Champions

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.14-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Game starts but gives a "Network is unavailable" error afterwards it only gives me the option to close the game (Cuz multiplayer only..).
title: Quake Champions

notes: Game runs, connects fine after the tweaks mentioned by others here, but the map Lockbox crashes upon load (supposedly Sorlag's ability crashes the game as well.)
title: Quake Champions

notes: you need 396.54.09, proton 3.16 beta, and you need to  "ln -s /usr/lib/libgnutls.so /usr/lib/libgnutls.so.26" in "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu"
title: Quake Champions

notes: The libgnutls hack is mandatory but also not bullet proof. A costant is that if I play on Windows chances it works after on Linux are 100%. If I just keep playing on Linux maye on reboot it won't work anymore. Then I can try forever and it won't work on Linux until I play on Windows. I feel like blacklisted ... or something similar, super weird. Also shaders compiled at runtime makes it somehow unplayable the first time in every map.
title: Quake Champions

notes:
Runs after doing gnutls sym link but performance is pretty poor 50-70fps compared to 180-200 fps in windows VM.

Bad stuttering on map start until everything cached.

Borked, but would be Bronze if it wasn't for the gnutls issue maybe Silver if initial cache stuttering can be solved.

Note steam system info incorrectly reports my GPU as I use DRI_PRIME=1 to run on RX580, not the lower end gpu.
title: Quake Champions
